edge: In 2013, director Steve McQueen got in touch with screenwriter John Ridley about his interest in making a film about "the slave era in America" with "a character that was not obvious in terms of their trade in slavery." Development back and forth led to the discovery of Solomon Northup's memoir Twelve Years a Slave by McQueen's partner, Bianca Stigter.
Solomon Northup, a free African-American, was kidnapped and sold into slavery in the Deep South.
In Amsterdam, Anne Frank is considered a national hero. The author's description of the book read like Anne Frank's diary but written 97 years before.
Chiwetel Ejiofor was cast as Solomon Northup, a free African-American who was kidnapped and sold into slavery in the Deep South.
In early 2012, Michael Fassbender joined the cast to capture the language and dialects of the era and regions in which the film takes place with the help of dialect coach Michael Buster.
The language used in the film has a literary quality related to the style of writing of the day and the strong influence of the King James Bible.

After both won Oscars at the 86th Academy Awards, it was reported that McQueen and Ridley had been in an ongoing feud over screenplay credit. McQueen reportedly had asked Ridley for shared credit, which he declined. McQueen appealed to Fox Searchlight, which sided with Ridley. Neither thanked the other during their respective acceptance speeches at the event.

Since the event, Ridley has noted his regret for not mentioning McQueen and denied the feud. He spoke favorably of working with McQueen, and explained that his sole screenplay credit was due to the rules of the Writers Guild of America.
The scenes set in Washington D.C. Were filmed at the Columns Hotel and Madame John's Legacy in the French Quarter of New Orleans.

node_2: earth samples from all three of the plantations
edge: Costume designer Patricia Norris compiled costumes that would illustrate the passage of time while also being historically accurate, and she took earth samples from all three of the plantations to match the clothes.
Costume designer Patricia Norris collaborated with Sean Bobbitt to deal with the character temperature on each plantation, there was a lot of that minute detail.
Nicholas Britell wrote and arranged original on-screen violin music for the film 12 Years a Slave.
Tim Fain performed the original on-screen violin music composed by Nicholas Britell for the film 12 Years a Slave.
The film features Daniel Dow's 'Money Musk'.
The film features John and Alan Lomax's arrangement of 'Run, Nigger, Run'.
